unit_learning_outcomes.description: Develop oral communication skills, listening skills, and teamwork skills.
Demonstrate understanding of assessment strategies, including formal and informal, diagnostic, formative and summative approaches to assess student learning.
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of research into how students learn and the implications for teaching.
Plan lesson sequences using knowledge of student learning, content and effective teaching strategies.
Demonstrate knowledge of a range of resources, including ICT, that engage students in their learning.
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the concepts, substance and structure of the content and strategies of Stage 6 of the mathematics syllabuses.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Readings and other asynchronous online activities related to the fortnightly online tutorials and workshops which students complete individually and discuss in iLearn Discussion Forums

enrolment_rules.description: ((TEP401 or EDTE4010(S)) and (TEP429 or EDTE4290)) or (EDST3010 and EDTE4290)

assessments.description: Students work in small groups to jointly plan a mathematics lesson; they provide individual peer feedback on the lesson from another group; and they write an individual reflection on what they have learned [1500 words]

Students design a mathematics topic test and accompanying mark scheme; they obtain feedback from a mathematics teacher, reflect on the feedback and revise the test and mark scheme as appropriate [2000 words]

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: EDTE4300 - Mathematics in the Secondary School II
data.description: This unit focuses on the secondary Mathematics curriculum and its teaching. There are three main themes in this unit: understanding the central concepts of school calculus; the role of assessment in Mathematics education; and learning and teaching Mathematics in Stage 6.
